*To:* Remon Smit
*Cc:* Liz Goulding; Colin Miller
*Subject:* RE: Privacy policy link on Mobile website Email Updates page
goes to full website****

 ****

Remon****

 ****

There are two links which have been set up incorrectly on the mobile
version of our sign up page.****

 ****

Can you please update****

**3.       **Privacy policy. It is currently linking to the full web
version and it should be linking to the mobile version****

**4.       **Terms of use. It is currently linking to the mobile web home
page. It should be linking to the mobile friendly page for our terms and
conditions.****

Can you let me know when updated please?>****

 ****

Remon – since I am in test mode for the next 48 hours, if you need anything
more than is in this email chain Liz or Colin should be able to help (and
approve the changes) in my absence.****

 ****

Thanks, Kate****

*From:* Colin Miller
*Sent:* 12 June 2012 16:27
*To:* Kate Walton
*Cc:* Liz Goulding
*Subject:* Privacy policy link on Mobile website Email Updates page goes to
full website****

 ****

Hi Kate****

 ****

During some recent regression testing of the mobile website to check
security settings, an anomaly was discovered regarding links on both the
Olympics and Paralympics mobile websites.****

 ****

There is a link at the bottom of every mobile website page “*Terms |
Privacy Policy | Cookies policy*”, the middle one going to a page regarding
privacy (but curiously titled “Moderation policy”).****

 ****

When you click on the *Email Updates* link near the bottom, you get a page
asking for an email address to send updates to, and two links – *Our terms*and
*Privacy policy* (again).  *Our terms* takes you not to a terms and
conditions page, but back to the home page of the mobile website.  The *Privacy
policy* link takes you not to the mobile-friendly page mentioned earlier,
but to the full website’s page on privacy.****

 ****

Two things seem to need addressing:****

 ****

**1.       **The *Our terms* link should go to a mobile friendly page that
gives our terms and conditions****

**2.       **The *Privacy policy* link should go to the mobile version of
our privacy policy and not the full website****

 ****

What is the best way to move forward on these issues?****

 ****
subject: Privacy policy link on Mobile website Email Updates page goes to full website

description:
Hi Kitsite,

Yesterday afternoon we received an alert on the London 2012 Festival site. I spoke to your support call centre who said you had just deployed a new piece of code to the Festival website which is referencing a favicon.png file that does not exist. This caused a large number of warnings in the error logs and as such the disk space quickly began to decrease.

Our agreed next steps were for Kitsite to insert a favicon.png file and also investigate where/how this file is being referenced on the Festival site. Can I please have an update on this - have you done this?
LOCOG's next steps were to rename and zip the apache error log to clear space. We have done this and this has done the trick for now - though this may become a repeatable issue until the issue is fixed.

For reference, here is the alert that was generated to us.

Description: ** PROBLEM - olympic-web05 - Olympic Web Server 5/Disk-/apps is WARNING **
Alert Type: Service
Notification Type: PROBLEM
Service: Disk-/apps
Hostname: olympicweb03.btgs2.bt-locog
Host Alias: olympic-web05 - Olympic Web Server 5
Address: 10.137.212.115
State: WARNING
Attribute: criticality=P2
Attribute: default_ipim_queue=BT-LOCOG-Unix-alerts
Additional Info:


Kind regards,

Joe Melville
Web Integrations and Mobile Lead
Technology Operations Centre

Direct line: +44 (0)30 2012 0691
toc.webintmobile@london2012.com

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London, E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000   |   www.london2012.com

P Please consider the environment before printing this email.

<hr width="100%">
The London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Limited
A company registered in England and Wales with its registered office at One Churchill Place, Canary Wharf, London E14 5LN and registered number 05267819 
          
This E-mail is confidential.  If you are not the addressee you may not copy, forward, disclose or use any part of it. If you have received this message in error, please delete it and all copies from your system and notify the sender immediately by return
E-mail.
             
Nothing in this message or its attachments is intended to create legal relations between us unless there is an express statement creating such relations or this message contains an authorised purchase order.
                                     
Internet communications cannot be guaranteed to be timely secure, error or virus-free. The sender does not accept liability for any errors or omissions.

http://www.london2012.com

description:
From: Morag Reavley <Morag.Reavley@london2012.com>

We are having a firewall exception made in China for London 2012
sites, so they can see them instead of having them blocked by their
Great Wall.

In terms of the Festival site, do we need to whitelist the GDP web
service? And if so, what is the URL we would need?

Thanks!
subject: Festival web service URL

Hi Tuesday,

You can add a single image, but I guess you already know that.

We could look at adding a video player, but I am not sure we could fit a video player and a block of text side by side (as it is currently when you have an image on the news template), were you envisioning it just sitting at the top or bottom of the main body text? 

In terms of introducing a Gallery to the news template, the existing galley template layout (and hence functionality) is significantly different from the news template, so not sure we could simple merge the two. However we could possibly look at adding some kind of scroller to the current image on the news template, that let you display/scroll through more than one image.

Adding a video to the news template would probably take about a 1/3 a day and modifying the existing image container so that you can assign more than one image which the user can then scroll though would probably be a additional days work.

Jamie

Many thanks.

I think we wont opt for an image scroller. I think if we choose to have a video, it should just sit on the bottom of the body text. I’ll confirm again if this is something we want to do. Any idea if this has any cost implications?

Many thanks

T

Hi Tuesday,

Yes, getting a video player setup and tested on the News template would probably take us 1/3 day to setup (~£250)

Jamie

Ok thanks, I’ll take this up with Claire and send you an email if we are going ahead with this.

The Media Bureau page however is our priority for now.

Best regards,

Tuesday

Thanks Tuesday,

I just want to run the Media Page quote past Kieran and then I get it sent over to you.

Jamie

description:
Hi,

We are thinking of creating a media centre page on the Festival website. Kindly see the brief below and let me know if this is do-able including info on cost and development.

Many thanks,

Tuesday

From: Paul Woodmansey
Sent: 28 May 2012 16:32
To: Tuesday Gutierrez
Subject: Media centre on website

Hi there,

Ideal world we would have:

ON THE HOMEPAGE:
'News' or 'Media' button at top of page (alongside Home<http://festival.london2012.com/index.php> /Events & Tickets<http://festival.london2012.com/events/index.php> /Backstage<http://festival.london2012.com/backstage/index.php> /About<http://festival.london2012.com/about/index.php>)

NEWS/Media PAGE:
The above link would click through to a page that displays latest press releases (by date) and has a drop down menu on the left and bottom similar to this: http://www.london2012.com/media-centre/

The extra links would be:

*         Latest press releases (takes you page similar to this http://www.london2012.com/media-centre/latest/). It would be good to have a search function on this page.

*         Video (opens this page as a pop up: http://www.london2012.com/media-centre/videos/)

*         Photo (goes to a page where we can host links to various media manager pages - the page would be similar to this but within the Festival website http://www.london2012.com/media-centre/photos-to-download/)

*         Festival Press Office (flat page that has contact details, map of how to find the London 2012 Festival Press Office, opening hours, etc)

*         Event accreditation (flat page that explains accreditation is through our partners)

*         Follow us (page which has details on how to get on press release distribution list, and explains that you  should follow us on Facebook, Twitter etc).

Does that all make sense? The London 2012 media centre is a good template but it doesn't have to be that sophisticated. I imagine that building the tool to do the press releases in date order could be quite complicated, so they could just be posted  in order so you scroll down to find them by date?

Paul



Paul Woodmansey
Press Officer - Culture, Ceremonies & Education

Hi Tuesday,

Thanks for this, certainly all looks very achievable, 

We'll discuss the details more internally tomorrow and will probably have a few question before we get back to you with a final quote, but I don't see any major issues, it all looks fairly straightforward.

But just for starters:

- Event accreditation : I assume this is just an info page ie. you don't actually require a backend to handle the accreditations?
- Follow us : once again is this just a text page / icons linking off to other places / sites? ie. do we need to integrate tightly with any mailing list software, ie. signup forms etc. 

Jamie

Hi Jamie

Yes to both:

Accreditation will just be an info page displaying the festival press office email address if people want contact info for the venues.

Follow us – yes, also will have the festival press office email address for media to send an email request to ‘sign up’ to receive press releases, then also all our social channels and general public sign up links.

Other info:
-backstage: we are currently building our content plan so we are hoping to have the backstage launched in two weeks

Hi Jamie

Any news on this?

Tuesday

Just finishing up a quote, should have it over to you tomorrow morning.

Jamie

Ok many thanks

Best regards,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

Please find attached costs for the Festival Media Centre section.

We've quoted for supporting the search, theme and date search/results as you requested / mirroring the functionality of the main site. 

I am not sure what volumes of press releases you are expecting, but removing the search functionality (and by implication the theme and date filtering, as these also require the search functionality) would reduce theses costs. At the most basic we could simply create a press release page that you add press releases (title, summary and link) to manually, but this would not provide any filtering etc.

Let me know how you want to proceed.

Jamie



London 2012 Festival - Kitsite - Media Centre - May 2012.pdf

Thanks Jamie

I will discuss this with the team and let you know as soon as possible.

Best regards,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

Really sorry, just realised that the costs page hadn't added up the days correctly.

Attached is a correct version (v2 / 31st May)

As mentioned before, please bear in mind that this is the 'bells and whistles' version, we could probably reduce some of the functionality (and hence costs) if budget is an issue.

Jamie



London 2012 Festival - Kitsite - Media Centre - May 2012 - V2.pdf

Hi Jamie

Just a quick question

Can we filter by location instead of theme?
When you click the press release, will it open in a separate word/pdf doc rather than the 2012 site which opens as a web page?

Best regards,

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

If "location" if a field that you are able enter or select (form a fixed, 1 level list) on the press releases then absolutely / it won''t affect the proposed costs.

Could you clarify if by "location" you mean / would like to assign / select from: 

	i) a fixed lists of locations (ie. a list of 20 regions)
	ii) a "free text" location field (be aware that the drop-down will be built form these regions)

note: although we could (in theory) allow you to tag each location with a postcode or geo-code (via a map/marker) this route would require extra development work as we would need to then map each geo-code or postcode back to a "location' value that could be used in a drop-down.

My guess is that a fixed list of say ~25 regions, cities or geographical location (one, not all) that you could tag press releases to / which would become the basis for building the location drop down would be the most sensible route.
		
Jamie
I think fixed list listing the nations / regions + a ‘UK wide’ one (and you should be able to tag the releases with more than one of those options).

Would it be possible to set it to a set number of locations ie.

Location1
Location2
Location3

(the reason I ask is we don't have a multi-select input option in the "meta data" panel of the CMS, so we either need list every region as a separate checkbox, which will make for a very ugly/cumbersome interface, or as suggested above have 2 or 3 location drop-downs which is slightly more manageable)

Thanks will update you tomorrow on this.

Tuesday

Hi Jamie

Would like to ask if we can have four items on search without the extra cost?

- Date

- Keyword

- Theme

- Location

If not, we can filter by

- Date

- Keyword

- location

Just awaiting confirmation from you on this and I’ll take this up with Paul, our head of press and Claire before giving a go signal.

Also on backstage, I think we are ready to launch next Wed (13 June). How do I launch this? Should I just add the content and publish?

Best regards,

Hi Tuesday,

Yes, that's fine, 

Assume your happy to just break them down by date as per main site (you can tag them up with a real date, which I guess will just be the publication or embargo date?)
http://www.london2012.com/media-centre/

re. locations is this just your normal list of nation/regions? whats the maximum number of regions you'd need to tag a single release to, would 2 or 3 suffice (bear in mind the more locations you have the more complex the interface will be).

Jamie


Screen shot 2012-06-07 at 11.55.13.png

Hi Jamie

List of Locations: We have 12 nations and regions plus another for UK wide

Yes we are happy to just be able to tag 2 or 3 locations in a single release

Dates: yes, we are ok with listing it as months and then we tag it with a real date

Tuesday

Kindly update the proposal and I’ll forward it to our financial head to raise a PO.

Many thanks

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

Please find attached a new version (v3 / 7th June) of the proposal, including clarification on the location and date tagging/searching.

thanks

Jamie



London 2012 Festival - Kitsite - Media Centre - May 2012 - V3.pdf
Thanks, will confirm later

Hi Jamie

Just a quick question, where will we find the media centre? Would there be a menu on the homepage or will it sit on the About section?

Claire wants it to be more obvious on the homepage but I think it shouldn’t go to the menu because it doesn’t really add anything to the user.
Do you think its best to put it in beside ‘Cultural Olympiad’ events?

Tuesday

Hi Tuesday,

It will live in /media - hope that is ok?

I agree with you, most users of it are going to be pointed to it directly by you (via a link in an email etc) or find it via Google. For most users of the site it will just seem confusing, and dare I say it a tad dry (if there not the intended audience). I think having it in the menu or footer will be fine, users who need access to it will find it (you can check the google stats and feedback from the intended user base to make sure its being found, and if you feel people are having difficultly finding it then promo it more prominently later on)

Sent from my iPad

Thanks, will confirm from Claire if that’s what she wants. I agree though that it has to stay in /mediacentre quick links just like the London 2012 website.

Just a quick note – media centre and Festival news are two things . Wahome wants ‘Festival news’ changed to ‘Festival updates’ to distinguish from media centre. He will get in touch later with Kitsite.

Hi Tuesday,

I'm not sure we ever received a PO for the media centre work, apologies if we did and it's disappeared in email somewhere (quite likely)

thanks

Jamie

Hi Jamie

I’ll chase this and get back to you tomorrow am.

Best regards,

Tuesday

Hey yeah, i wondered the same - i think i had not published a file ~ which i did now, so it will show a kind-a full-size video. The video delivered doesn't seem to be sized-up correctly, so i think someone needs to speak to to get id's for videos that are 670px wide. 

Or we leave it as is.

This is how it is:
https://festival2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/news/2012/07/street-soccer-and-forest-pitch-reveal-four-scottish-olym.php

Lars

Ok thanks. I think I’ll delete the video of this event because the video is low quality. So should the video size get bigger now or do I need to speak with someone to do that?

  Best regards,

  Tuesday

    From:    Lars Bortfeldt [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
 Sent:  09 July 2012 13:31
 To:  Tuesday Gutierrez
 Subject:  [PostCMS support] Re: 80% CPU

Hi Lars

  The video is now full-width but it does look a little bit odd with the white space around it. If we can’t get it to the proper full-width, I think the only option is to make it in the smaller original version – at least the white space is just at the bottom.

  Many thanks

    From:    Lars Bortfeldt [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
 Sent:  09 July 2012 13:31
 To:  Tuesday Gutierrez
 Subject:  [PostCMS support] Re: 80% CPU

Hi Tuesday,

The problem (which we have only just remembered) is that the TwoFour player doesn't expand the video content (to fit) when you expand the player.

Unless TwoFour can supply a player that expands the content to fill the full width of a larger player and ideally encode the video content at a higher resolution (so they don't appear 'blown up' at a larger size) I'm afraid were limited to that player.

(IIRC they used to supply a player that allowed us to expand the video, but some time last year it was replaced with a new version which removed this capability as they host the player we can't revert back to the older version)

We can get rid of the white on either side (which will look better) and just centre the normal sized player, but we can't totally eliminate the white underneath the video player (as this is part of the player / used to display subtitles if they are enabled).

There was a long discussion on the main www site re. allowing larger sized videos, I have been searching my inbox for the final conclusion, but I think the problem was that a larger player would have required the content to be re-encoded and therefore it was decided to keep with the standard sized player.

We don't have direct contact with TwoFour, it may be worth talking to Tom Price-Stephens <Tom.Price-Stephens@london2012.com> in LOCOG NewMedia (as he's the contact with TwoFour) to see if he can shed any light on why the video content won't expand to fit a larger player.  If we can get new video player code/markup that allows larger videos then we'll be happy to swap them over.

In the mean time, I think we're just going to have to live with a centred / standard size player.

Jamie

Hi Jamie

  Thanks for the info. Ok let’s just keep it to the small size and put it at the centre.

  Many thanks!

  Tuesday

    From:    Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
 Sent:  09 July 2012 15:34
 To:  Tuesday Gutierrez
 Subject:  [PostCMS support] Re: 80% CPU
I've put it back on small and centered!

Ok thanks!

  Best regards,

  Tuesday

    From:    Lars Bortfeldt [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
 Sent:  09 July 2012 16:41
 To:  Tuesday Gutierrez
 Subject:  [PostCMS support] Re: 80% CPU

what change were you referring to when you said the following, in your

 > Also since uploading has been changed (see screenshot),
 > I am having trouble uploading photos.
?
Kieran

Sorry for the confusion

Before it was changed to ‘simple upload’, I also had to add one photo after another (add, save, refresh). The difference is, the photos appear on the window below. After the change to ‘simple upload’ This time however, I needed to upload ALL photos first on the folder images/backstage. Hi Tuesday,

We're seeing a scroller (see attached screenshot) what browser are you using?

Also not sure what you mean by "since uploading has been changed" we haven't changed the way images are uploaded? 

(although I notice you have "use simple image upload" checked, which may be what is causing confusion, you should be able yo uncheck this)

Secondly you can upload images/assign images in two ways:

1) Upload your images into a folder and *then* open a page and assign them.
2) Upload an image and assign an image in one step (inside the page editor)

The advantage of (1) is you can upload multiple images as a zip file and then easily assign multiple images to a page, I think this is what you want to do.

Do also un-check the "use simple upload" checkbox (unless you have this checked for a specific reason, it;s really only there for users who can't use Flash).

Jamie

site is ready for review. I've attached a zip file with all the
accompanying files, but the one to look for is "backstage_new.htm".

wanted to share early for your feedback and queries. Note that the
only implementation required is the content between header and footer
as these remain exactly as on live site.

not expected to go live until week of May 7th. There's a major

Hi Wahome,

A couple of hopefully easy to answer questions, 

1) "Rename the current "Backstage" to "Gallery" - both the UI (e.g. H1 on the template) and link structure to video/photo collections"

The question here is mainly related to the way / order we do this, and just wanted to run it past you.

	a) Stop anything inside /backstage syncing to live from staging (this will mean no updated to /gallery while we do this)
	b) Move everything in the folder /backstage to a new /gallery folder (there is a question here re. broken links ie. external and internal and what we do with them, the CMS should get re-mapped (but external ones of course won't, not much we can do here and I am sure it will eventually correct itself, it's more a FYI before we do this and someone asks why the links don't work!)
	c) Rename the index page title from Backstage to Gallery (or is it Galleries?) 
	e) We may need to republish the whole site to get urls/paths to remap from /backstage to /gallery (not a big deal)
 
Is that everything or have we missed something?

	a) This will go in the old /backstage folder (which will now be empty)
	b) Will these page link to"Events" or editorial pages like news or Videos/Photo like before? (prob. doesn't matter, just interested)
	c) Will these pages - that are linked to - live inside the ""Backstage" section? or elsewhere on the site (once again, prob. doesn't matter, just interested)
	d) We have assumed you want to manually link and will fill in the details+summary manually? (rather than this having any automation)
	e) We have to fixed the maximum number of cells to 20 for now? (we can increase but assume that is fine for now)

3) New "Backstage" template (Twitter feed widget)

	We have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

4) New "Backstage" template (Facebook feed widget)

	Ditto above, we have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

5) New "Backstage" template (Highlights from the Gallery)

	How are these assigned? do you want to assign them manually (this is what we have assumed) or should they pull automatically from the latest Video/Photo pages, or just mirror the top three items on the Gallery index page (word of warning, this may be the trickiest of all three to implement, but obv we can do it if required just may take a little longer than the other two options)

I think that's it for now

Jamie

these but will run through quickly with inline comments:

1) "Rename the current "Backstage" to "Gallery" - both the UI (e.g. H1 on
the template) and link structure to video/photo collections"

The question here is mainly related to the way / order we do this, and just
wanted to run it past you.

a) Stop anything inside /backstage syncing to live from staging (this will

at** time
of synching*

won't, not much we can do here and I am sure it will eventually correct

don't work!)

*- Unresolved url's should simply land on new backstage.*

c) Rename the index page title from Backstage to Gallery (or is it

*- Gallery (of photo/video 'collections' e.g. art gallery)*

e) We may need to republish the whole site to get urls/paths to remap from
/backstage to /gallery (not a big deal)

Is that everything or have we missed something?

*- Looks comprehensive right now.*

2) New "Backstage" template (migration + link questions)

a) This will go in the old /backstage folder (which will now be empty)
b) Will these page link to"Events" or editorial pages like news or
Videos/Photo like before? (prob. doesn't matter, just interested)

*- The links will point to whatever content editor wants to highlight - an
event, a search results page, a collection in gallery, news article, etc *

c) Will these pages - that are linked to - live inside the ""Backstage"
section? or elsewhere on the site (once again, prob. doesn't matter, just
interested)

*- The pages live wherever the story points to. NB: There is no need to
archive 'editorial highlights' - they only exist for as long as they appear
on the list of backstage stories *

d) We have assumed you want to manually link and will fill in the
details+summary manually? (rather than this having any automation)

*- Yes, all parts of each story **(image, title, short paragraph) **will be
edited manually as the main objective of new backstage is to add a more
'engaging editorial voice' to existing content on the site*

e) We have to fixed the maximum number of cells to 20 for now? (we can
increase but assume that is fine for now)

*- 20 is ok if a bit too much. Ideal number of stories recommended for
editorial is 5-7, but a bigger cap doesn't hurt (or does it?).*

3) New "Backstage" template (Twitter feed widget)

We have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do you want us to
implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here? what account
should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we can use?

*- Yes, the idea is for you to simply copy/paste the js widget for Twitter
Festival's twitter handle (@london2012fest) with the right look&feel. If
you prefer I can customise and send the code from Twitter (**
http://twitter.com/about/resources/widgets/widget_profile)*

4) New "Backstage" template (Facebook feed widget)

Ditto above, we have simply received an image of this (see attached). Do
you want us to implement the HTML / full backend twitter integration here?
what account should we use? Is there a Javascript widget from the GTW we
can use?

*- Same as for Twitter above*

5) New "Backstage" template (Highlights from the Gallery)

How are these assigned? do you want to assign them manually (this is what
we have assumed) or should they pull automatically from the latest
Video/Photo pages, or just mirror the top three items on the Gallery index
page (word of warning, this may be the trickiest of all three to implement,
but obv we can do it if required just may take a little longer than the
other two options)

*- These should be automated to show the topmost three collections from the
Gallery (as these are the ones the editor would have
highlighted/tagged/ordered as most important to look at in the Gallery).
Remember clicking on any of the 3 highlights in new Backstage will load
that collection in the player within the Gallery where the user can then
view more collections.*

Hi Liz,

We never had any concept of "French images". We did have alt text translated into French for the French site but the actual images were just the same images that appeared on the English site.

You should already have all of the images that the French site uses, as they would have been contained in zip exports.

I might be misunderstanding your question though. Are you asking for a zip file that JUST contains images that are referenced by the French site? If so then this is certainly possible but it would probably take at least a day or so (and - unless you indicate it is super-high priority) we wouldn't be able to start it until Monday.

Once you've clarified your requirement I can give you a firmer time/cost estimate.

Kind regards,

Kieran

Ah, ok. For some reason I thought that the images referenced in the French site might have been stored in a separate file/folder structure. So to clarify what you are saying is that if a static image was used on the English site, it would be the same on the French?

What I am saying is that the English page and the French translation of the English page display(ed) the same images. Meaning that all of the images that you require for the French site /should/ be in the zip files that Jamie provided you with in recent months. If any are missing though, please let me know.
Kind regards,
Kieran

description:
Hello guys,


We have a redirect rule set up for all date based media releases, so that the old urls redirect to the new ones.  However, it turns out that not all of the old urls are date based (e.g. http://www.london2012.com/press/media-releases/post-bid-2005/first-100-days.php) doesn't contain any date reference and our URL-rewrite doesn't know how to correctly handle them.  There also seems to be a 'bid-phase'.  Do you have a list of any other sub-folders or formats that our media releases used to take so we can arrange for the appropriate redirects?

Thanks!

Liz


Liz Goulding
Lead New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

All of the press releases are in folders named:

except for the two you have drawn attention to:
 /press/media-releases/bid-phase

plus, finally,
 /press/media-releases/cultural-olympiad
Is this what you need to know? Or are you looking for some kind of mapping
from file path -> date (or something similar)?
Kind regards,
Kieran
That is exactly what I needed to know!

description:
Hi Lars/Jamie

There are some problems regarding events that have been excluded from feed. I've flagged this to GDP but not sure if this is a Kitsite issue


1.       Festival Events that we have excluded from feed are still appearing on the What's on page of the London 2012.

2.       Also, Changes we have made on copy are not also appearing on the What's on although they are updated on the Festival website which we have done since Tuesday. Kindly see email thread below for an example.

Many thanks,

Tuesday

From: David Bradley
Sent: 17 May 2012 18:02
To: Tuesday Gutierrez
Cc: McKenzie Young; Morag Reavley; Claire Hutchinson; Nathalie Meghriche; Stephanie Akinyelure
Subject: FW: Big Dance Website Amends - List to exclude from feed.

Hi Tuesday,

As discussed, there appears to be a problem with uploading to the 2012 'What's On' page, as it is not updating changes made or events created.

The correct information is appearing on the Festival website, but not on 'What's On'.  The app, too, hasn't been updating and so it would be worth ascertaining if this is because of the 'What's On' problem or a separate issue.

An example of an event excluded from the feed, yet still appearing is Big Dance North West England:

http://www.london2012.com/join-in/whats-on/event=9000962085/index.htmx

The opposite is true (Not excluded from the feed, yet live) is on:

http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961220

These errors are also evident on the app.

I have also created and edited some CO events today, but they are not appearing on 'What's On'.

Could you contact Kitsite and GDP to see what the issue is and move for a resolution, please?

Thanks,

David.


From: Nathalie Meghriche
Sent: 17 May 2012 11:22
To: David Bradley; Festival Marketing
Cc: Claire Hutchinson; Eckhard Thiemann
Subject: RE: Big Dance Website Amends - List to exclude from feed.

On the app and a few of them on the website but I didn't check them all so they may have been rogue ones.

From: David Bradley
Sent: 17 May 2012 11:13
To: Nathalie Meghriche; Festival Marketing
Cc: Claire Hutchinson; Eckhard Thiemann
Subject: RE: Big Dance Website Amends - List to exclude from feed.

Did you find these on the website or the app, because these were excluded before I left Tuesday evening?

Chris mentioned that they are on the app and I'm talking to Morag about it, now.

D.

Sent: 17 May 2012 10:59

Cc: Claire Hutchinson; Eckhard Thiemann
